hero.headline: How to Create YouTube Community Polls
hero.subheadline: Get audience input. Boost engagement with polls.

sections.content: Polls are engagement machines—easy for viewers to participate, valuable feedback for you. They appear in subscribers' feeds and on your Community tab, keeping your channel active between uploads. Here's how to create polls that drive engagement and inform your content strategy.

faq.question: How many subscribers needed for polls?
faq.answer: 500 subscribers minimum to access Community tab and post polls. This threshold was lowered from 1,000. Once unlocked, polls are a powerful engagement tool.

faq.question: How often should I post polls?
faq.answer: Weekly or bi-weekly works well. Don't spam—quality over quantity. Space between video uploads. Too many polls fatigue your audience.

faq.question: Can I see who voted?
faq.answer: No—poll responses are anonymous. You see total numbers and percentages only. This encourages honest participation without social pressure.

faq.question: Do polls help the algorithm?
faq.answer: Indirectly—engagement signals show active community. Polls keep your channel visible in feeds between uploads. Algorithm likes channels that maintain audience connection.
